contents.verseText: In the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, to fulfill the word of the LORD spoken through Jeremiah, the LORD stirred the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia to send a proclamation throughout his kingdom and to put it in writing as follows:
contents: In the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, to fulfill the word of the LORD spoken through Jeremiah, the LORD stirred the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia to send a proclamation throughout his kingdom and to put it in writing as follows:

contents.verseText: “This is what Cyrus king of Persia says: ‘The LORD, the God of heaven, who has given me all the kingdoms of the earth, has appointed me to build a house for Him at Jerusalem in Judah.
contents: “This is what Cyrus king of Persia says:
‘The LORD, the God of heaven, who has given me all the kingdoms of the earth, has appointed me to build a house for Him at Jerusalem in Judah.

contents.verseText: Whoever among you belongs to His people, may his God be with him, and may he go to Jerusalem in Judah and build the house of the LORD, the God of Israel; He is the God who is in Jerusalem.
contents: Whoever among you belongs to His people, may his God be with him, and may he go to Jerusalem in Judah and build the house of the LORD, the God of Israel; He is the God who is in Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: And let every survivor, wherever he lives, be assisted by the men of that region with silver, gold, goods, and livestock, along with a freewill offering for the house of God in Jerusalem.’”
contents: And let every survivor, wherever he lives, be assisted by the men of that region with silver, gold, goods, and livestock, along with a freewill offering for the house of God in Jerusalem.’”

contents.verseText: So the family heads of Judah and Benjamin, along with the priests and Levites—everyone whose spirit God had stirred—prepared to go up and rebuild the house of the LORD in Jerusalem.
contents: So the family heads of Judah and Benjamin, along with the priests and Levites—everyone whose spirit God had stirred—prepared to go up and rebuild the house of the LORD in Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: And all their neighbors supported them with articles of silver and gold, with goods and livestock, and with valuables, in addition to all their freewill offerings.

contents: (This is the text of the letter they sent to him.)
To King Artaxerxes,
From your servants, the men west of the Euphrates:

contents.verseText: Let it be known to the king that the Jews who came from you to us have returned to Jerusalem. And they are rebuilding that rebellious and wicked city, restoring its walls, and repairing its foundations.
contents: Let it be known to the king that the Jews who came from you to us have returned to Jerusalem. And they are rebuilding that rebellious and wicked city, restoring its walls, and repairing its foundations.

contents.verseText: Let it now be known to the king that if that city is rebuilt and its walls are restored, they will not pay tribute, duty, or toll, and the royal treasury will suffer.
contents: Let it now be known to the king that if that city is rebuilt and its walls are restored, they will not pay tribute, duty, or toll, and the royal treasury will suffer.

contents.verseText: Now because we are in the service of the palace and it is not fitting for us to allow the king to be dishonored, we have sent to inform the king
contents: Now because we are in the service of the palace

footnote.ft: Literally because the salt of the palace is the salt we eat

contents: and it is not fitting for us to allow the king to be dishonored, we have sent to inform the king

contents.verseText: that a search should be made of the record books of your fathers. In these books you will discover and verify that the city is a rebellious city, harmful to kings and provinces, inciting sedition from ancient times. That is why this city was destroyed.
contents: that a search should be made of the record books of your fathers. In these books you will discover and verify that the city is a rebellious city, harmful to kings and provinces, inciting sedition from ancient times. That is why this city was destroyed.

contents.verseText: We advise the king that if this city is rebuilt and its walls are restored, you will have no dominion west of the Euphrates.
contents: We advise the king that if this city is rebuilt and its walls are restored, you will have no dominion west of the Euphrates.

contents.verseText: Then the king sent this reply: To Rehum the commander, Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of your associates living in Samaria and elsewhere in the region west of the Euphrates: Greetings.
contents: Then the king sent this reply:

Greetings.

contents.verseText: The letter you sent us has been translated and read in my presence.
contents: The letter you sent us has been translated and read in my presence.

contents.verseText: I issued a decree, and a search was conducted. It was discovered that this city has revolted against kings from ancient times, engaging in rebellion and sedition.
contents: I issued a decree, and a search was conducted. It was discovered that this city has revolted against kings from ancient times, engaging in rebellion and sedition.

contents.verseText: And mighty kings have ruled over Jerusalem and exercised authority over the whole region west of the Euphrates; and tribute, duty, and toll were paid to them.
contents: And mighty kings have ruled over Jerusalem and exercised authority over the whole region west of the Euphrates; and tribute, duty, and toll were paid to them.

contents.verseText: Now, therefore, issue an order for these men to stop, so that this city will not be rebuilt until I so order.
contents: Now, therefore, issue an order for these men to stop, so that this city will not be rebuilt until I so order.

contents.verseText: See that you do not neglect this matter. Why allow this threat to increase and the royal interests to suffer?
contents: See that you do not neglect this matter. Why allow this threat to increase and the royal interests to suffer?

contents.verseText: When the text of the letter from King Artaxerxes was read to Rehum, Shimshai the scribe, and their associates, they went immediately to the Jews in Jerusalem and forcibly stopped them.

contents.verseText: Thus the construction of the house of God in Jerusalem ceased, and it remained at a standstill until the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.
contents: Thus the construction of the house of God in Jerusalem ceased, and it remained at a standstill until the second year of the reign of Darius king of Persia.

contents.verseText: Later, the prophets Haggai and Zechariah son of Iddo prophesied to the Jews in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel, who was over them.
contents: Later, the prophets Haggai and Zechariah son of Iddo prophesied to the Jews in Judah and Jerusalem in the name of the God of Israel, who was over them.

contents.verseText: Then Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua son of Jozadak rose up and began to rebuild the house of God in Jerusalem. And the prophets of God were with them, helping them.
contents: Then Zerubbabel son of Shealtiel and Jeshua son of Jozadak

contents: rose up and began to rebuild the house of God in Jerusalem. And the prophets of God were with them, helping them.

contents.verseText: At that time Tattenai the governor of the region west of the Euphrates, Shethar-bozenai, and their associates went to the Jews and asked, “Who authorized you to rebuild this temple and restore this structure?”
contents: At that time Tattenai the governor of the region west of the Euphrates,

footnote.ft: Aramaic the governor beyond the River; also in verse 6

contents: Shethar-bozenai, and their associates went to the Jews and asked, “Who authorized you to rebuild this temple and restore this structure?”

contents.verseText: They also asked, “What are the names of the men who are constructing this building?”
contents: They also asked,

contents: “What are the names of the men who are constructing this building?”

contents.verseText: But the eye of their God was on the elders of the Jews, so that they were not stopped until a report was sent to Darius and written instructions about this matter were returned.
contents: But the eye of their God was on the elders of the Jews, so that they were not stopped until a report was sent to Darius and written instructions about this matter were returned.

contents.verseText: This is the text of the letter that Tattenai the governor of the region west of the Euphrates, Shethar-bozenai, and their associates, the officials in the region, sent to King Darius.
contents: This is the text of the letter that Tattenai the governor of the region west of the Euphrates, Shethar-bozenai, and their associates, the officials in the region, sent to King Darius.

contents.verseText: The report they sent him read as follows: To King Darius: All peace.
contents: The report they sent him read as follows:
To King Darius:
All peace.

contents.verseText: Let it be known to the king that we went into the province of Judah, to the house of the great God. The people are rebuilding it with large stones, and placing timbers in the walls. This work is being carried out diligently and is prospering in their hands.
contents: Let it be known to the king that we went into the province of Judah, to the house of the great God. The people are rebuilding it with large stones, and placing timbers in the walls. This work is being carried out diligently and is prospering in their hands.

contents.verseText: So we questioned the elders and asked, “Who authorized you to rebuild this temple and restore this structure?”
contents: So we questioned the elders and asked, “Who authorized you to rebuild this temple and restore this structure?”

contents.verseText: We also asked for their names, so that we could write down the names of their leaders for your information.
contents: We also asked for their names, so that we could write down the names of their leaders

footnote.ft: Aramaic the names of the men at their heads

contents: for your information.

contents.verseText: And this is the answer they returned: “We are servants of the God of heaven and earth, and we are rebuilding the temple that was built many years ago, which a great king of Israel built and completed.
contents: And this is the answer they returned:
“We are servants of the God of heaven and earth, and we are rebuilding the temple that was built many years ago, which a great king of Israel built and completed.

contents.verseText: But since our fathers angered the God of heaven, He delivered them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean who destroyed this temple and carried away the people to Babylon.
contents: But since our fathers angered the God of heaven, He delivered them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, the Chaldean who destroyed this temple and carried away the people to Babylon.

contents.verseText: In his first year, however, Cyrus king of Babylon issued a decree to rebuild this house of God.
contents: In his first year, however, Cyrus king of Babylon issued a decree to rebuild this house of God.

contents.verseText: He also removed from the temple of Babylon the gold and silver articles belonging to the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar had taken and carried there from the temple in Jerusalem. King Cyrus gave these articles to a man named Sheshbazzar, whom he appointed governor
contents: He also removed from the temple

footnote.ft: Or palace

contents: of Babylon the gold and silver articles belonging to the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar had taken and carried there from the temple in Jerusalem. King Cyrus gave these articles to a man named Sheshbazzar, whom he appointed governor

contents.verseText: and instructed, ‘Take these articles, put them in the temple in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be rebuilt on its original site.’
contents: and instructed, ‘Take these articles, put them in the temple in Jerusalem, and let the house of God be rebuilt on its original site.’

contents.verseText: So this Sheshbazzar came and laid the foundation of the house of God in Jerusalem, and from that time until now it has been under construction, but it has not yet been completed.”
contents: So this Sheshbazzar came and laid the foundation of the house of God in Jerusalem, and from that time until now it has been under construction, but it has not yet been completed.”

contents.verseText: Now, therefore, if it pleases the king, let a search be made of the royal archives in Babylon to see if King Cyrus did indeed issue a decree to rebuild the house of God in Jerusalem. Then let the king send us his decision in this matter.
contents: Now, therefore, if it pleases the king, let a search be made of the royal archives in Babylon to see if King Cyrus did indeed issue a decree to rebuild the house of God in Jerusalem. Then let the king send us his decision in this matter.

contents.verseText: Thus King Darius ordered a search of the archives stored in the treasury of Babylon.
contents: Thus King Darius ordered a search of the archives stored in the treasury of Babylon.

contents.verseText: And a scroll was found in the fortress of Ecbatana, in the province of Media, with the following written on it: Memorandum:
contents: And a scroll was found in the fortress of Ecbatana, in the province of Media, with the following written on it:
Memorandum:

contents.verseText: In the first year of King Cyrus, he issued a decree concerning the house of God in Jerusalem: Let the house be rebuilt as a place for offering sacrifices, and let its foundations be firmly laid. It is to be sixty cubits high and sixty cubits wide,
contents: In the first year of King Cyrus, he issued a decree concerning the house of God in Jerusalem:
Let the house be rebuilt as a place for offering sacrifices, and let its foundations be firmly laid. It is to be sixty cubits high and sixty cubits wide,

footnote.ft: The house was to be approximately 90 feet or 27.4 meters in height and width; Syriac (see also 1 Kings 6:2) It is to be sixty cubits long, twenty cubits wide, and thirty cubits high.

contents.verseText: with three layers of cut stones and one of timbers. The costs are to be paid from the royal treasury.
contents: with three layers of cut stones and one of timbers. The costs are to be paid from the royal treasury.

contents.verseText: Furthermore, the gold and silver articles of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took from the temple in Jerusalem and carried to Babylon, must also be returned to the temple in Jerusalem and deposited in the house of God.
contents: Furthermore, the gold and silver articles of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took from the temple in Jerusalem and carried to Babylon, must also be returned to the temple in Jerusalem and deposited in the house of God.

contents.verseText: Therefore Darius decreed: To Tattenai governor of the region west of the Euphrates, Shethar-bozenai, and your associates and officials in the region: You must stay away from that place!
contents: Therefore Darius decreed:
To Tattenai governor of the region west of the Euphrates,

footnote.ft: Aramaic governor beyond the River; similarly in verses 8 and 13

contents: Shethar-bozenai, and your associates and officials in the region:
You must stay away from that place!

contents.verseText: Leave this work on the house of God alone. Let the governor and elders of the Jews rebuild this house of God on its original site.
contents: Leave this work on the house of God alone. Let the governor and elders of the Jews rebuild this house of God on its original site.

contents.verseText: I hereby decree what you must do for these elders of the Jews who are rebuilding this house of God: The cost is to be paid in full to these men from the royal treasury out of the taxes of the provinces west of the Euphrates, so that the work will not be hindered.
contents: I hereby decree what you must do for these elders of the Jews who are rebuilding this house of God:
The cost is to be paid in full to these men from the royal treasury out of the taxes of the provinces west of the Euphrates, so that the work will not be hindered.

contents.verseText: Whatever is needed—young bulls, rams, and lambs for burnt offerings to the God of heaven, as well as wheat, salt, wine, and oil, as requested by the priests in Jerusalem—must be given to them daily without fail.
contents: Whatever is needed—young bulls, rams, and lambs for burnt offerings to the God of heaven, as well as wheat, salt, wine, and oil, as requested by the priests in Jerusalem—must be given to them daily without fail.

contents.verseText: Then they will be able to offer sacrifices of a sweet aroma to the God of heaven and to pray for the lives of the king and his sons.
contents: Then they will be able to offer sacrifices of a sweet aroma to the God of heaven and to pray for the lives of the king and his sons.

contents.verseText: I also decree that if any man interferes with this directive, a beam is to be torn from his house and raised up, and he is to be impaled on it. And his own house shall be made a pile of rubble for this offense.
contents: I also decree that if any man interferes with this directive, a beam is to be torn from his house and raised up, and he is to be impaled on it. And his own house shall be made a pile of rubble for this offense.

footnote.ft: Literally shall be made a dunghill because of this

contents.verseText: May God, who has caused His Name to dwell there, overthrow any king or people who lifts a hand to alter this decree or to destroy this house of God in Jerusalem. I, Darius, have issued the decree. Let it be carried out with diligence.
contents: May God, who has caused His Name to dwell there, overthrow any king or people who lifts a hand to alter this decree or to destroy this house of God in Jerusalem.
I, Darius, have issued the decree. Let it be carried out with diligence.

contents.verseText: In response, Tattenai the governor of the region west of the Euphrates, Shethar-bozenai, and their associates diligently carried out what King Darius had decreed.
contents: In response, Tattenai the governor of the region west of the Euphrates, Shethar-bozenai, and their associates diligently carried out what King Darius had decreed.

contents.verseText: So the Jewish elders built and prospered through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah son of Iddo. They finished building according to the command of the God of Israel and the decrees of Cyrus, Darius, and Artaxerxes, kings of Persia.
contents: So the Jewish elders built and prospered through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah son of Iddo.
They finished building according to the command of the God of Israel and the decrees of Cyrus, Darius, and Artaxerxes, kings of Persia.

contents.verseText: And this temple was completed on the third day of the month of Adar, in the sixth year of the reign of King Darius.
contents: And this temple was completed on the third day of the month of Adar,

footnote.ft: Adar is the twelfth month of the Hebrew lunar calendar, usually occurring within the months of February and March.

contents: in the sixth year of the reign of King Darius.

contents.verseText: Then the people of Israel—the priests, the Levites, and the rest of the exiles—celebrated the dedication of the house of God with joy.
contents: Then the people of Israel—the priests, the Levites, and the rest of the exiles—celebrated the dedication of the house of God with joy.

contents.verseText: For the dedication of the house of God they offered a hundred bulls, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs, and a sin offering for all Israel of twelve male goats, one for each tribe of Israel.
contents: For the dedication of the house of God they offered a hundred bulls, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs, and a sin offering for all Israel of twelve male goats, one for each tribe of Israel.

contents.verseText: They also appointed the priests by their divisions and the Levites by their groups to the service of God in Jerusalem, according to what is written in the Book of Moses.
contents: They also appointed the priests by their divisions and the Levites by their groups to the service of God in Jerusalem, according to what is written in the Book of Moses.

s1: The Returned Exiles Keep the Passover

contents.verseText: On the fourteenth day of the first month, the exiles kept the Passover.
contents: On the fourteenth day of the first month, the exiles kept the Passover.

contents.verseText: All the priests and Levites had purified themselves and were ceremonially clean. And the Levites slaughtered the Passover lamb for all the exiles, for their priestly brothers, and for themselves.
contents: All the priests and Levites had purified themselves and were ceremonially clean.
And the Levites slaughtered the Passover lamb for all the exiles, for their priestly brothers, and for themselves.

contents.verseText: The Israelites who had returned from exile ate it, together with all who had separated themselves from the uncleanness of the peoples of the land to seek the LORD, the God of Israel.
contents: The Israelites who had returned from exile ate it, together with all who had separated themselves from the uncleanness of the peoples

footnote.ft: Or nations

contents: of the land to seek the LORD, the God of Israel.

contents.verseText: For seven days they kept the Feast of Unleavened Bread with joy, because the LORD had made them joyful and turned the heart of the king of Assyria toward them to strengthen their hands in the work on the house of the God of Israel.
contents: For seven days they kept the Feast of Unleavened Bread

footnote.ft: That is, the seven-day period after the Passover during which no leaven may be eaten; see Exodus 12:14–20.

contents: with joy, because the LORD had made them joyful and turned the heart of the king of Assyria toward them to strengthen their hands in the work on the house of the God of Israel.

contents.verseText: Many years later, during the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,
contents: Many years later,

footnote.ft: Literally After these things

contents: during the reign of Artaxerxes king of Persia, Ezra son of Seraiah, the son of Azariah, the son of Hilkiah,

contents.verseText: the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,
contents: the son of Shallum, the son of Zadok, the son of Ahitub,

contents.verseText: the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
contents: the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,

contents.verseText: the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,
contents: the son of Zerahiah, the son of Uzzi, the son of Bukki,

contents.verseText: the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest—
contents: the son of Abishua, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the chief priest—

contents.verseText: this Ezra came up from Babylon. He was a scribe skilled in the Law of Moses, which the LORD, the God of Israel, had given. The king had granted Ezra all his requests, for the hand of the LORD his God was upon him.
contents: this Ezra came up from Babylon. He was a scribe skilled in the Law of Moses, which the LORD, the God of Israel, had given.
The king had granted Ezra all his requests, for the hand of the LORD his God was upon him.

contents.verseText: So in the seventh year of King Artaxerxes, he went up to Jerusalem with some of the Israelites, including priests, Levites, singers, gatekeepers, and temple servants.
contents: So in the seventh year of King Artaxerxes, he went up to Jerusalem with some of the Israelites, including priests, Levites, singers, gatekeepers, and temple servants.

footnote.ft: Hebrew Nethinim; also in verse 24

contents.verseText: Ezra arrived in Jerusalem in the fifth month of the seventh year of the king.
contents: Ezra arrived in Jerusalem in the fifth month of the seventh year of the king.

contents.verseText: He had begun the journey from Babylon on the first day of the first month, and he arrived in Jerusalem on the first day of the fifth month, for the gracious hand of his God was upon him.
contents: He had begun the journey from Babylon on the first day of the first month, and he arrived in Jerusalem on the first day of the fifth month, for the gracious hand of his God was upon him.

contents.verseText: For Ezra had set his heart to study the Law of the LORD, to practice it, and to teach its statutes and ordinances in Israel.
contents: For Ezra had set his heart to study the Law of the LORD, to practice it, and to teach its statutes and ordinances in Israel.

contents.verseText: This is the text of the letter King Artaxerxes had given to Ezra the priest and scribe, an expert in the commandments and statutes of the LORD to Israel:
contents: This is the text of the letter King Artaxerxes had given to Ezra the priest and scribe, an expert in the commandments and statutes of the LORD to Israel:

footnote.ft: The original text of Ezra 7:12–26 is in Aramaic.

contents.verseText: Artaxerxes, king of kings. To Ezra the priest, the scribe of the Law of the God of heaven: Greetings.
contents: Artaxerxes, king of kings.
To Ezra the priest, the scribe of the Law of the God of heaven:
Greetings.

footnote.ft: Aramaic Perfect now (probably a greeting)

contents.verseText: I hereby decree that any volunteers among the Israelites in my kingdom, including the priests and Levites, may go up with you to Jerusalem.
contents: I hereby decree that any volunteers among the Israelites in my kingdom, including the priests and Levites, may go up with you to Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: You are sent by the king and his seven counselors to evaluate Judah and Jerusalem according to the Law of your God, which is in your hand.
contents: You are sent by the king and his seven counselors to evaluate Judah and Jerusalem according to the Law of your God, which is in your hand.

contents.verseText: Moreover, you are to take with you the silver and gold that the king and his counselors have freely offered to the God of Israel, whose dwelling is in Jerusalem,
contents: Moreover, you are to take with you the silver and gold that the king and his counselors have freely offered to the God of Israel, whose dwelling is in Jerusalem,

contents.verseText: together with all the silver and gold you may find in all the province of Babylon, as well as the freewill offerings of the people and priests to the house of their God in Jerusalem.
contents: together with all the silver and gold you may find in all the province of Babylon, as well as the freewill offerings of the people and priests to the house of their God in Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: With this money, therefore, you are to buy as many bulls, rams, and lambs as needed, together with their grain offerings and drink offerings, and offer them on the altar at the house of your God in Jerusalem.
contents: With this money, therefore, you are to buy as many bulls, rams, and lambs as needed, together with their grain offerings and drink offerings, and offer them on the altar at the house of your God in Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: You and your brothers may do whatever seems best with the rest of the silver and gold, according to the will of your God.
contents: You and your brothers may do whatever seems best with the rest of the silver and gold, according to the will of your God.

contents.verseText: You must deliver to the God of Jerusalem all the articles given to you for the service of the house of your God.
contents: You must deliver to the God of Jerusalem all the articles given to you for the service of the house of your God.

contents.verseText: And if anything else is needed for the house of your God that you may have occasion to supply, you may pay for it from the royal treasury.
contents: And if anything else is needed for the house of your God that you may have occasion to supply, you may pay for it from the royal treasury.

contents.verseText: I, King Artaxerxes, decree to all the treasurers west of the Euphrates: Whatever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the Law of the God of heaven, may require of you, it must be provided promptly,
contents: I, King Artaxerxes, decree to all the treasurers west of the Euphrates:

footnote.ft: Aramaic beyond the River; also in verse 25

contents: Whatever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the Law of the God of heaven, may require of you, it must be provided promptly,

contents.verseText: up to a hundred talents of silver, a hundred cors of wheat, a hundred baths of wine, a hundred baths of olive oil, and salt without limit.
contents: up to a hundred talents of silver,

contents: a hundred cors of wheat,

footnote.ft: 100 cors is approximately 624 bushels or 22,000 liters (probably about 19.2 tons or 17.4 metric tons of wheat).

contents: a hundred baths of wine,

footnote.ft: 100 baths is approximately 580 gallons or 2,200 liters of wine.

contents: a hundred baths of olive oil,

footnote.ft: Or 100 baths of oil; that is, approximately 580 gallons or 2,200 liters

contents: and salt without limit.

contents.verseText: Whatever is commanded by the God of heaven must be done diligently for His house. For why should wrath fall on the realm of the king and his sons?
contents: Whatever is commanded by the God of heaven must be done diligently for His house. For why should wrath fall on the realm of the king and his sons?

contents.verseText: And be advised that you have no authority to impose tribute, duty, or toll on any of the priests, Levites, singers, doorkeepers, temple servants, or other servants of this house of God.
contents: And be advised that you have no authority to impose tribute, duty, or toll on any of the priests, Levites, singers, doorkeepers, temple servants, or other servants of this house of God.

contents.verseText: And you, Ezra, according to the wisdom of your God which you possess, are to appoint magistrates and judges to judge all the people west of the Euphrates—all who know the laws of your God. And you are to teach these laws to anyone who does not know them.
contents: And you, Ezra, according to the wisdom of your God which you possess, are to appoint magistrates and judges to judge all the people west of the Euphrates—all who know the laws of your God. And you are to teach these laws to anyone who does not know them.

contents.verseText: If anyone does not keep the law of your God and the law of the king, let a strict judgment be executed against him, whether death, banishment, confiscation of property, or imprisonment.
contents: If anyone does not keep the law of your God and the law of the king, let a strict judgment be executed against him, whether death, banishment, confiscation of property, or imprisonment.

contents.verseText: Blessed be the LORD, the God of our fathers, who has put into the heart of the king to so honor the house of the LORD in Jerusalem,
contents: Blessed be the LORD, the God of our fathers, who has put into the heart of the king to so honor the house of the LORD in Jerusalem,

contents.verseText: and who has shown me favor before the king, his counselors, and all his powerful officials. And because the hand of the LORD my God was upon me, I took courage and gathered the leaders of Israel to return with me.
contents: and who has shown me favor before the king, his counselors, and all his powerful officials.

contents.verseText: They also brought 220 of the temple servants, all designated by name. David and the officials had appointed them to assist the Levites.
contents: They also brought 220 of the temple servants, all designated by name. David and the officials had appointed them to assist the Levites.

contents.verseText: And there by the Ahava Canal I proclaimed a fast, so that we might humble ourselves before our God and ask Him for a safe journey for us and our children, with all our possessions.
contents: And there by the Ahava Canal I proclaimed a fast, so that we might humble ourselves before our God and ask Him for a safe journey for us and our children, with all our possessions.

contents.verseText: For I was ashamed to ask the king for an escort of soldiers and horsemen to protect us from our enemies on the road, since we had told him, “The hand of our God is gracious to all who seek Him, but His great anger is against all who forsake Him.”
contents: For I was ashamed to ask the king for an escort of soldiers and horsemen to protect us from our enemies on the road, since we had told him, “The hand of our God is gracious to all who seek Him, but His great anger is against all who forsake Him.”

contents.verseText: So we fasted and petitioned our God about this, and He granted our request.
contents: So we fasted and petitioned our God about this, and He granted our request.

contents.verseText: Then I set apart twelve of the leading priests, together with Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and ten of their brothers,
contents: Then I set apart twelve of the leading priests, together with Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and ten of their brothers,

contents.verseText: and I weighed out to them the contribution of silver and gold and the articles that the king, his counselors, his leaders, and all the Israelites there had offered for the house of our God.
contents: and I weighed out to them the contribution of silver and gold and the articles that the king, his counselors, his leaders, and all the Israelites there had offered for the house of our God.

contents.verseText: I weighed out into their hands 650 talents of silver, articles of silver weighing 100 talents, 100 talents of gold,
contents: I weighed out into their hands 650 talents of silver,

footnote.ft: 650 talents is approximately 24.5 tons or 22.2 metric tons of silver.

contents: articles of silver weighing 100 talents,

footnote.ft: 100 talents is approximately 3.77 tons or 3.42 metric tons of silver articles.

contents: 100 talents of gold,

footnote.ft: 100 talents is approximately 3.77 tons or 3.42 metric tons of gold.

contents.verseText: 20 gold bowls valued at 1,000 darics, and two articles of fine polished bronze, as precious as gold.
contents: 20 gold bowls valued at 1,000 darics,

footnote.ft: Or worth 1,000 drachmas; that is, approximately 18.5 pounds or 8.4 kilograms of gold

contents: and two articles of fine polished bronze, as precious as gold.

contents.verseText: Then I told them, “You are holy to the LORD, and these articles are holy. The silver and gold are a freewill offering to the LORD, the God of your fathers.
contents: Then I told them, “You are holy to the LORD, and these articles are holy. The silver and gold are a freewill offering to the LORD, the God of your fathers.

contents.verseText: Guard them carefully until you weigh them out in the chambers of the house of the LORD in Jerusalem before the leading priests, Levites, and heads of the Israelite families.”
contents: Guard them carefully until you weigh them out in the chambers of the house of the LORD in Jerusalem before the leading priests, Levites, and heads of the Israelite families.”

contents.verseText: So the priests and Levites took charge of the silver and gold and sacred articles that had been weighed out to be taken to the house of our God in Jerusalem.
contents: So the priests and Levites took charge of the silver and gold and sacred articles that had been weighed out to be taken to the house of our God in Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: On the twelfth day of the first month we set out from the Ahava Canal to go to Jerusalem, and the hand of our God was upon us to protect us from the hands of the enemies and bandits along the way.
contents: On the twelfth day of the first month we set out from the Ahava Canal to go to Jerusalem, and the hand of our God was upon us to protect us from the hands of the enemies and bandits along the way.

contents.verseText: So we arrived at Jerusalem and rested there for three days.
contents: So we arrived at Jerusalem and rested there for three days.

contents.verseText: On the fourth day, in the house of our God, we weighed out the silver and gold and sacred articles into the hand of Meremoth son of Uriah, the priest. Eleazar son of Phinehas was with him, along with the Levites Jozabad son of Jeshua and Noadiah son of Binnui.
contents: On the fourth day, in the house of our God, we weighed out the silver and gold and sacred articles into the hand of Meremoth son of Uriah, the priest. Eleazar son of Phinehas was with him, along with the Levites Jozabad son of Jeshua and Noadiah son of Binnui.

contents.verseText: Everything was verified by number and weight, and the total weight was recorded at that time.
contents: Everything was verified by number and weight, and the total weight was recorded at that time.

contents.verseText: Then the exiles who had returned from captivity sacrificed burnt offerings to the God of Israel: 12 bulls for all Israel, 96 rams, 77 lambs, and a sin offering of 12 male goats. All this was a burnt offering to the LORD.
contents: Then the exiles who had returned from captivity sacrificed burnt offerings to the God of Israel: 12 bulls for all Israel, 96 rams, 77 lambs, and a sin offering of 12 male goats. All this was a burnt offering to the LORD.

contents.verseText: They also delivered the king’s edicts to the royal satraps and governors of the region west of the Euphrates, who proceeded to assist the people and the house of God.
contents: They also delivered the king’s edicts to the royal satraps

footnote.ft: A satrap was a Persian official.

contents: and governors of the region west of the Euphrates,

footnote.ft: Hebrew governors beyond the River

contents: who proceeded to assist the people and the house of God.

contents.verseText: After these things had been accomplished, the leaders approached me and said, “The people of Israel, including the priests and Levites, have not kept themselves separate from the surrounding peoples whose abominations are like those of the Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Jebusites, Ammonites, Moabites, Egyptians, and Amorites.
contents: After these things had been accomplished, the leaders approached me and said, “The people of Israel, including the priests and Levites, have not kept themselves separate from the surrounding peoples whose abominations are like those of the Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Jebusites, Ammonites, Moabites, Egyptians, and Amorites.

contents.verseText: Indeed, the Israelites have taken some of their daughters as wives for themselves and their sons, so that the holy seed has been mixed with the people of the land. And the leaders and officials have taken the lead in this unfaithfulness!”
contents: Indeed, the Israelites have taken some of their daughters as wives for themselves and their sons, so that the holy seed has been mixed with the people of the land. And the leaders and officials have taken the lead in this unfaithfulness!”

contents.verseText: When I heard this report, I tore my tunic and cloak, pulled out some hair from my head and beard, and sat down in horror.
contents: When I heard this report, I tore my tunic and cloak, pulled out some hair from my head and beard, and sat down in horror.

contents.verseText: Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel gathered around me because of the unfaithfulness of the exiles, while I sat there in horror until the evening offering.
contents: Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel gathered around me because of the unfaithfulness of the exiles, while I sat there in horror until the evening offering.

contents.verseText: At the evening offering, I got up from my humiliation with my tunic and cloak torn, and I fell on my knees, spread out my hands to the LORD my God,
contents: At the evening offering, I got up from my humiliation with my tunic and cloak torn, and I fell on my knees, spread out my hands to the LORD my God,

contents.verseText: and said: “O my God, I am ashamed and embarrassed to lift up my face to You, my God, because our iniquities are higher than our heads, and our guilt has reached the heavens.
contents: and said:
“O my God, I am ashamed and embarrassed to lift up my face to You, my God, because our iniquities are higher than our heads, and our guilt has reached the heavens.

contents.verseText: From the days of our fathers to this day, our guilt has been great. Because of our iniquities, we and our kings and priests have been delivered into the hands of the kings of the earth and put to the sword and captivity, to pillage and humiliation, as we are this day.
contents: From the days of our fathers to this day, our guilt has been great. Because of our iniquities, we and our kings and priests have been delivered into the hands of the kings of the earth and put to the sword and captivity, to pillage and humiliation, as we are this day.

contents.verseText: But now, for a brief moment, grace has come from the LORD our God to preserve for us a remnant and to give us a stake in His holy place. Even in our bondage, our God has given us new life and light to our eyes.
contents: But now, for a brief moment, grace has come from the LORD our God to preserve for us a remnant and to give us a stake

footnote.ft: Or nail or foothold

contents: in His holy place. Even in our bondage, our God has given us new life and light to our eyes.

contents.verseText: Though we are slaves, our God has not forsaken us in our bondage, but He has extended to us grace in the sight of the kings of Persia, giving us new life to rebuild the house of our God and repair its ruins, and giving us a wall of protection in Judah and Jerusalem.
contents: Though we are slaves, our God has not forsaken us in our bondage, but He has extended to us grace in the sight of the kings of Persia, giving us new life to rebuild the house of our God and repair its ruins, and giving us a wall of protection in Judah and Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: And now, our God, what can we say after this? For we have forsaken the commandments
contents: And now, our God, what can we say after this? For we have forsaken the commandments

contents.verseText: that You gave through Your servants the prophets, saying: ‘The land that you are entering to possess is a land polluted by the impurity of its peoples and the abominations with which they have filled it from end to end.
contents: that You gave through Your servants the prophets, saying: ‘The land that you are entering to possess is a land polluted by the impurity of its peoples and the abominations with which they have filled it from end to end.

contents.verseText: Now, therefore, do not give your daughters in marriage to their sons or take their daughters for your sons. Never seek their peace or prosperity, so that you may be strong and may eat the good things of the land, leaving it as an inheritance to your sons forever.’
contents: Now, therefore, do not give your daughters in marriage to their sons or take their daughters for your sons. Never seek their peace or prosperity, so that you may be strong and may eat the good things of the land, leaving it as an inheritance to your sons forever.’

contents.verseText: After all that has come upon us because of our evil deeds and our great guilt (though You, our God, have punished us less than our iniquities deserve and have given us such a remnant as this),
contents: After all that has come upon us because of our evil deeds and our great guilt (though You, our God, have punished us less than our iniquities deserve and have given us such a remnant as this),

contents.verseText: shall we again break Your commandments and intermarry with the peoples who commit these abominations? Would You not become so angry with us as to wipe us out, leaving no remnant or survivor?
contents: shall we again break Your commandments and intermarry with the peoples who commit these abominations? Would You not become so angry with us as to wipe us out, leaving no remnant or survivor?

contents.verseText: O LORD, God of Israel, You are righteous! For we remain this day as a remnant. Here we are before You in our guilt, though because of it no one can stand before You.”
contents: O LORD, God of Israel, You are righteous! For we remain this day as a remnant. Here we are before You in our guilt, though because of it no one can stand before You.”

contents.verseText: While Ezra prayed and made this confession, weeping and falling facedown before the house of God, a very large assembly of Israelites—men, women, and children—gathered around him, and the people wept bitterly as well.
contents: While Ezra prayed and made this confession, weeping and falling facedown before the house of God, a very large assembly of Israelites—men, women, and children—gathered around him, and the people wept bitterly as well.

contents.verseText: Then Shecaniah son of Jehiel, an Elamite, said to Ezra: “We have been unfaithful to our God by marrying foreign women from the people of the land, yet in spite of this, there is hope for Israel.
contents: Then Shecaniah son of Jehiel, an Elamite, said to Ezra: “We have been unfaithful to our God by marrying foreign women from the people of the land, yet in spite of this, there is hope for Israel.

contents.verseText: So now let us make a covenant before our God to send away all the foreign wives and their children, according to the counsel of my lord and of those who tremble at the command of our God. Let it be done according to the Law.
contents: So now let us make a covenant before our God to send away all the foreign wives and their children, according to the counsel of my lord and of those who tremble at the command of our God. Let it be done according to the Law.

contents.verseText: Get up, for this matter is your responsibility, and we will support you. Be strong and take action!”
contents: Get up, for this matter is your responsibility, and we will support you. Be strong and take action!”

contents.verseText: So Ezra got up and made the leading priests, Levites, and all Israel take an oath to do what had been said. And they took the oath.
contents: So Ezra got up and made the leading priests, Levites, and all Israel take an oath to do what had been said. And they took the oath.

contents.verseText: Then Ezra withdrew from before the house of God and walked to the chamber of Jehohanan son of Eliashib. And while he stayed there, he ate no food and drank no water, because he was mourning over the unfaithfulness of the exiles.
contents: Then Ezra withdrew from before the house of God and walked to the chamber of Jehohanan son of Eliashib. And while he stayed

footnote.ft: Or went

contents: there, he ate no food and drank no water, because he was mourning over the unfaithfulness of the exiles.

contents.verseText: And a proclamation was issued throughout Judah and Jerusalem that all the exiles should gather at Jerusalem.
contents: And a proclamation was issued throughout Judah and Jerusalem that all the exiles should gather at Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Whoever failed to appear within three days would forfeit all his property, according to the counsel of the leaders and elders, and would himself be expelled from the assembly of the exiles.
contents: Whoever failed to appear within three days would forfeit all his property, according to the counsel of the leaders and elders, and would himself be expelled from the assembly of the exiles.

contents.verseText: So within the three days, all the men of Judah and Benjamin assembled in Jerusalem, and on the twentieth day of the ninth month, all the people sat in the square at the house of God, trembling regarding this matter and because of the heavy rain.
contents: So within the three days, all the men of Judah and Benjamin assembled in Jerusalem, and on the twentieth day of the ninth month, all the people sat in the square at the house of God, trembling regarding this matter and because of the heavy rain.

contents.verseText: Then Ezra the priest stood up and said to them, “You have been unfaithful by marrying foreign women, adding to the guilt of Israel.
contents: Then Ezra the priest stood up and said to them, “You have been unfaithful by marrying foreign women, adding to the guilt of Israel.

contents.verseText: Now, therefore, make a confession to the LORD, the God of your fathers, and do His will. Separate yourselves from the people of the land and from your foreign wives.”
contents: Now, therefore, make a confession to the LORD, the God of your fathers, and do His will. Separate yourselves from the people of the land and from your foreign wives.”

contents.verseText: And the whole assembly responded in a loud voice: “Truly we must do as you say!
contents: And the whole assembly responded in a loud voice: “Truly we must do as you say!

contents.verseText: But there are many people here, and it is the rainy season. We are not able to stay out in the open. Nor is this the work of one or two days, for we have transgressed greatly in this matter.
contents: But there are many people here, and it is the rainy season. We are not able to stay out in the open. Nor is this the work of one or two days, for we have transgressed greatly in this matter.

contents.verseText: Let our leaders represent the whole assembly. Then let everyone in our towns who has married a foreign woman come at an appointed time, together with the elders and judges of each town, until the fierce anger of our God in this matter is turned away from us.”
contents: Let our leaders represent the whole assembly. Then let everyone in our towns who has married a foreign woman come at an appointed time, together with the elders and judges of each town, until the fierce anger of our God in this matter is turned away from us.”

contents.verseText: (Only Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahzeiah son of Tikvah, supported by Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite, opposed this plan.)
contents: (Only Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahzeiah son of Tikvah, supported by Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite, opposed this plan.)

contents.verseText: So the exiles did as proposed. Ezra the priest selected men who were family heads, each of them identified by name, to represent their families. On the first day of the tenth month they launched the investigation,
contents: So the exiles did as proposed. Ezra the priest selected men who were family heads, each of them identified by name, to represent their families. On the first day of the tenth month they launched the investigation,

contents.verseText: and by the first day of the first month they had dealt with all the men who had married foreign women.
contents: and by the first day of the first month they had dealt with all the men who had married foreign women.

contents.verseText: Among the descendants of the priests who had married foreign women were found these descendants of Jeshua son of Jozadak and his brothers: Maaseiah, Eliezer, Jarib, and Gedaliah.
contents: Among the descendants of the priests who had married foreign women were found these descendants of Jeshua son of Jozadak

contents: They pledged to send their wives away, and for their guilt they presented a ram from the flock as a guilt offering.
